summary: An email exchange from January 29, 2015, where Jeffrey Epstein forwards a news article about himself allegedly targeting a well-known actress at age 13 to an unidentified recipient, who reacts with shock. The email includes a confidentiality notice claiming attorney-client privilege and copyright protection.

persons.name: Jeffrey E.
persons.role: Email sender/recipient, subject of news article
persons.context: Appears as both the sender of an email forwarding a news article about himself and as the recipient of a shocked reply. The email signature suggests he is associated with 'JEE'.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein news article
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein forwards a news article alleging he targeted a well-known actress at age 13 to an unidentified recipient, who replies 'Oh no no no! Un F ing believable!!'

keyFacts: On January 29, 2015, Jeffrey Epstein forwarded a news article from 'trunews.com' with the headline 'jeffrey-epstein-allegedly-targeted-well-known-actress-13'.
The recipient of the forwarded email reacted with extreme shock, writing 'Oh no no no! Un F ing believable!!'.
The email contains a confidentiality notice claiming the information may be attorney-client privileged and is the property of 'JEE', suggesting a legal or corporate entity associated with Epstein.
